text: Athar-Ali Fyzee was an Indian international tennis and table tennis player. == Table tennis == Athar-Ali Fyzee took part in the first 1926 World Table Tennis Championships in London. Here he won the bronze medal with the Indian men's team which included his brother Hassan Ali Fyzee. ==Tennis== He represented India in the India Davis Cup team and participated in 15 editions of the Wimbledon Championships between 1910 and 1933. His best result in the singles event was reaching the third round in 1926. ==See also== * List of table tennis players * List of World Table Tennis Championships medalists == References == == External links == * * * Category:1883 births Category:Indian male table tennis players Category:Racket sportspeople from Mumbai Category:Indian male tennis players Category:Olympic tennis players of India Category:Tennis players at the 1924 Summer Olympics Category:Year of death missing Category:World Table Tennis Championships medalists
title: Athar-Ali Fyzee
